properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 19 at 2:59PM PST until January 21 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON...

.A cold front will bring widespread precipitation to northwest
California Monday night into Tuesday. Snow levels will be much
higher than with last week's storm, initially around 4500 feet,
then tending to fall closer to 4000 feet on Tuesday. This will
result in mostly rain and wet road conditions along the passes of
Highway 299, and just minor accumulations, if any, along Highway
36. However, up to a foot of snow will be possible above 4500
feet, including Scott Mountain Summit on Highway 3.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 4500 feet. Total snow
accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible. Winds could gust as
high as 50 mph in exposed mountainous terrain.

* WHERE...Northern Trinity County including Scott Mountain Summit
on Highway 3.

* WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Chain
requirements over Scott Mountain Summit and periods of road
closure are possible. Blowing and drifting snow could make
visibility poor.
properties.instruction:
* If you must travel, carry an emergency kit with tire chains,
flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications.

* Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm.

* The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 4500 FEET
